sentences: how much battery (does <name> have [left]|has <name> got [left]|is left in <name>)
(do you know|tell me) if there are any {on_off_domains:domain} {on_off_states:state} [<in_area_floor>]
[how much] time [is] left on [the|my] timer[s] in <area>
how long [is] left on [the|my] timer[s] in <area>

errors.no_area: Sorry, I am not aware of any area called {{ area }}
errors.no_floor: Sorry, I am not aware of any floor called {{ floor }}
errors.no_domain: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ domain.replace('_', ' ') }}
errors.no_domain_in_area: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ domain.replace('_', ' ') }} in the {{ area }} area
errors.no_domain_in_floor: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ domain.replace('_', ' ') }} on the {{ floor }} floor
errors.no_device_class: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ device_class }}
errors.no_device_class_in_area: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ device_class }} in the {{ area }} area
errors.no_device_class_in_floor: Sorry, I am not aware of any {{ device_class }} in the {{ floor }} floor
errors.no_entity: Sorry, I am not aware of any device called {{ entity }}
errors.no_entity_in_area: Sorry, I am not aware of any device called {{ entity }} in the {{ area }} area
errors.no_entity_in_floor: Sorry, I am not aware of any device called {{ entity }} in the {{ floor }} floor
errors.entity_wrong_state: Sorry, no device is {{ state | lower }}
errors.feature_not_supported: Sorry, no device supports the required features
errors.no_entity_in_area_exposed: Sorry, {{ entity }} in the {{ area }} area is not exposed
errors.no_entity_in_floor_exposed: Sorry, {{ entity }} in the {{ floor }} floor is not exposed
errors.no_domain_in_area_exposed: Sorry, no {{ domain.replace('_', ' ') }} in the {{ area }} area is exposed
errors.no_domain_in_floor_exposed: Sorry, no {{ domain.replace('_', ' ') }} in the {{ floor }} floor is exposed
errors.no_device_class_in_area_exposed: Sorry, no {{ device_class }} in the {{ area }} area is exposed
errors.no_device_class_in_floor_exposed: Sorry, no {{ device_class }} in the {{ floor }} floor is exposed
errors.duplicate_entities: Sorry, there are multiple devices called {{ entity }}
errors.duplicate_entities_in_area: Sorry, there are multiple devices called {{ entity }} in the {{ area }} area
errors.duplicate_entities_in_floor: Sorry, there are multiple devices called {{ entity }} in the {{ floor }} floor
errors.timer_not_found: Sorry, I couldn't find that timer
errors.multiple_timers_matched: Sorry, I am unable to target multiple timers
errors.no_timer_support: Sorry, timers are not supported on this device

HassTurnOff.default:
{% set translations = {
  "button": "the button",
  "camera": "the camera",
  "input_button": "the button",
  "alarm_control_panel": "the alarm",
  "automation": "the automation",
  "fan": "the fan",
  "climate": "the thermostat",
  "humidifier": "the humidifier",
  "input_boolean": "the switch",
  "siren": "the siren",
  "water_heater": "the water heater",
  "light": "the light",
  "switch": "the switch",
  "remote": "the remote",
  "vacuum": "the vacuum cleaner",
  "media_player": "the media player",
  "lawn_mower": "the lawn mower"
} %} Turned off {{ translations.get(state.domain) }}
HassTurnOff.light_all: Turned off all of the lights
HassTurnOff.fan_all: Turned off all of the fans

HassClimateSetTemperature.default: Temperature set to {{ slots.temperature }} {{ 'degree' if (slots.temperature | float) == 1 else 'degrees' }}

HassStartTimer.default: {% set h = slots.hours if slots.hours is defined else none %} {% set m = slots.minutes if slots.minutes is defined else none %} {% set s = slots.seconds if slots.seconds is defined else none %} {% set h_text = h ~ (' hour'  if h in [ "1", 'one'] else ' hours') if h else '' %} {% set m_text = (30 if m in ['half', '1/2'] else m) ~ (' minute' if m in [ "1", 'one'] else ' minutes') if m else '' %} {% set s_text = (30 if s in ['half', '1/2'] else s) ~ (' second' if s in [ "1", 'one'] else ' seconds') if s else '' %} {% set text_list = [ h_text, m_text, s_text] | select() | list %} {% set text = text_list[:-1] | join(', ') ~ ' and ' ~ text_list[-1] if text_list | count > 2 else text_list | join(' and ') %} {% set name = (' named ' ~ slots.name | trim) if slots.name is defined else '' %} Timer set for {{ text }}{{ name }}
HassStartTimer.command: {% set h = slots.hours if slots.hours is defined else none %} {% set m = slots.minutes if slots.minutes is defined else none %} {% set s = slots.seconds if slots.seconds is defined else none %} {% set h_text = h ~ (' hour'  if h in [ "1", 'one'] else ' hours') if h else '' %} {% set m_text = (30 if m in ['half', '1/2'] else m) ~ (' minute' if m in [ "1", 'one'] else ' minutes') if m else '' %} {% set s_text = (30 if s in ['half', '1/2'] else s) ~ (' second' if s in [ "1", 'one'] else ' seconds') if s else '' %} {% set text_list = [ h_text, m_text, s_text] | select() | list %} {% set text = text_list[:-1] | join(', ') ~ ' and ' ~ text_list[-1] if text_list | count > 2 else text_list | join(' and ') %} Command will be executed in {{ text }}

{% set translations = {

HassTurnOn.light_all: Turned on all of the lights

HassGetCurrentTime.default:
{% set minute_str = '{0:02d}'.format(slots.time.minute) %}
{% if slots.time.hour == 0: %} 12:{{ minute_str }} AM {% elif slots.time.hour < 12: %} {{ slots.time.hour }}:{{ minute_str }} AM {% elif slots.time.hour == 12: %} 12:{{ minute_str }} PM {% else: %} {{ slots.time.hour - 12 }}:{{ minute_str }} PM {% endif %}

HassGetWeather.default:
{% set weather_condition = {
  'clear': 'and clear',
  'clear-night': 'and clear',
  'cloudy': 'and cloudy',
  'exceptional': 'and exceptional',
  'fog': 'with fog',
  'hail': 'with hail',
  'lightning': 'with lightning',
  'lightning-rainy': 'with lightning and rain',
  'partlycloudy': 'and partly cloudy',
  'pouring': 'and pouring rain',
  'rainy': 'and raining',
  'snowy': 'and snowing',
  'snowy-rainy': 'with snow and rain',
  'sunny': 'and sunny',
  'windy': 'and windy',
  'windy-variant': 'with wind and clouds'
} %} {{ state.attributes.get('temperature') }} {{ state.attributes.get('temperature_unit') }} {{ weather_condition.get((state.state | string).lower(), "") }}

HassCancelAllTimers.default: {% if slots.canceled < 1: %} No timers were canceled. {% elif slots.canceled == 1: %} Canceled 1 timer. {% else: %} Canceled {{ slots.canceled }} timers. {% endif %}
HassCancelAllTimers.area: {% if slots.canceled < 1: %} No timers were canceled in {{ slots.area }}. {% elif slots.canceled == 1: %} Canceled 1 timer in {{ slots.area }}. {% else: %} Canceled {{ slots.canceled }} timers in {{ slots.area }}. {% endif %}

HassClimateGetTemperature.default: {% set current_temperature = state_attr(state.entity_id, 'current_temperature') %} {% set temperature = state.state if current_temperature is none else current_temperature %} {% if temperature == 1: %} {{ temperature }} degree {% else: %} {{ temperature }} degrees {% endif %}

HassDecreaseTimer.default: {% set h = slots.hours if slots.hours is defined else none %} {% set m = slots.minutes if slots.minutes is defined else none %} {% set s = slots.seconds if slots.seconds is defined else none %} {% set h_text = h ~ (' hour'  if h in [ "1", 'one'] else ' hours') if h else '' %} {% set m_text = (30 if m in ['half', '1/2'] else m) ~ (' minute' if m in [ "1", 'one'] else ' minutes') if m else '' %} {% set s_text = (30 if s in ['half', '1/2'] else s) ~ (' second' if s in [ "1", 'one'] else ' seconds') if s else '' %} {% set text_list = [ h_text, m_text, s_text] | select() | list %} {% set text = text_list[:-1] | join(', ') ~ ' and ' ~ text_list[-1] if text_list | count > 2 else text_list | join(' and ') %} {% set name = (' named ' ~ slots.name | trim) if slots.name is defined else '' %} {{ text }} removed from timer{{ name }}

HassIncreaseTimer.default: {% set h = slots.hours if slots.hours is defined else none %} {% set m = slots.minutes if slots.minutes is defined else none %} {% set s = slots.seconds if slots.seconds is defined else none %} {% set h_text = h ~ (' hour'  if h in [ "1", 'one'] else ' hours') if h else '' %} {% set m_text = (30 if m in ['half', '1/2'] else m) ~ (' minute' if m in [ "1", 'one'] else ' minutes') if m else '' %} {% set s_text = (30 if s in ['half', '1/2'] else s) ~ (' second' if s in [ "1", 'one'] else ' seconds') if s else '' %} {% set text_list = [ h_text, m_text, s_text] | select() | list %} {% set text = text_list[:-1] | join(', ') ~ ' and ' ~ text_list[-1] if text_list | count > 2 else text_list | join(' and ') %} {% set name = (' named ' ~ slots.name | trim) if slots.name is defined else '' %} {{ text }} added to timer{{ name }}

HassRespond.listening: No, I only record when you speak the wake word.
HassRespond.data: Your data is sent to your Home Assistant server.
HassRespond.commands: To learn what you can ask, visit home dash assistant dot I.O. slash voice.
HassRespond.creator: I was created by the wonderful Home Assistant community, made up of tinkerers world wide.

expansion_rules.name: [<the>] {name}
expansion_rules.timer_duration_minutes: ({timer_minutes:minutes} minute[s] [[and] {timer_seconds:seconds} second[s]])|({timer_minutes:minutes} and [a] {timer_half:seconds} minute[s])|({timer_half:seconds} a minute[s])
expansion_rules.timer_duration_hours: ({timer_hours:hours} hour[s] [[and] {timer_minutes:minutes} minute[s]] [[and] {timer_seconds:seconds} second[s]])|({timer_hours:hours} and [a] {timer_half:minutes} hour[s])|({timer_half:minutes} an hour[s])
